metadata.title: CVE-2022-3078 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel through 5.16-rc6. There is alack of check after calling vzalloc() and lack of free after allocation indrivers/media/test-drivers/vidtv/vidtv_s302m.c.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3078` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1051-ibm - 5.4.0-1010.11~18.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
